alert.note: Alert for Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 12:15AM EDT until July 10 at 5:30AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of western Massachusetts and southern Vermont, including the following counties, in western Massachusetts, Berkshire. In southern Vermont, Bennington and Windham. * WHEN...Until 315 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1214 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsfield, Bennington, North Adams, Adams, Williamstown, Pownal, Cheshire, Wilmington, Stamford, Readsboro, Florida, Savoy, New Ashford, Berkshire, Dalton, Lanesborough, Hinsdale, Whitingham, Windsor and Peru. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
